website_summaries.verdict: Many runners commented that the shoe was comfortable and breathable. They were happy that the outsole provided excellent traction for different types of roads and conditions. Although some runners were disappointed because of the product's narrow toe box and smaller shoe length than the standard size, others still recommended Inov-8 Roadclaw 275 v2 because of its versatility, durability, and performance on any running sessions.
pros: A good number of users said that the shoe was breathable and lightweight
Many runners loved its lacing system
A lot of testers commented that the cushioning was comfortable
According to those who have tried it, the shoe performed well on tracks, parks, and roads
Some reviewers agreed on the versatility and durability of the Inov-8 Roadclaw 275 v2
A lot of purchasers said that the product was best for short and long-distance running activities
Many runners mentioned that the sole provided enough traction on the surfaces
cons: A consumer mentioned that the toe box was a bit narrow
As a result, he was not able to spread out his toes comfortably
Some runners said that the shoe length was smaller than the standard fit

customer_reviews.title: avoid if you have wide feet.
customer_reviews.text: After about 100km of on-tarmac running, the upper is starting to wear through on my right foot. the little toe sticks out a bit having broken it years ago and has rubbed away the shoe lining and my sock is now visible through the hole. a real shame after 3-1/2 months and 100km. My faith in Inov-8 shoes ( this is my third pair) has wavered somewhat. i know it's my wonky foot is the cause, but my previous running shoes have not had this issue.
customer_reviews.author: carol coupland

customer_reviews.title: Wide as you like!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect road running shoes for me. Previously with Inov-8 I had to go at least a size up but that's no longer the case with their newer models. So nice and wide and stretchy in the toe-box with great air-flow through the material.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Great trainers.
customer_reviews.text: Love Inov 8. This is my 4th pair. I was using the Flight 235's but they didn't give enough heel support when running. The road claws are just awesome, would highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Vinen

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant fit and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Excellent fitting shoe,very light.Bought for the road after previously buying Inov8 Trailtalon trail shoes which exceeded expectation. The road shoes are very comfortable,not sure yet if the cushioning will stand up to longer runs,but medium distance seems fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mr G Nicholls

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money, badly designed !
customer_reviews.text: This trainers are the worse I ve ever purchased. Holes started to appear on the front outer edges just by the little toe. It’s not as if I am a seasoned runner! The furthest I ve ran in these are 5 km! Totally put me off Inov8 wast of money.
customer_reviews.author: MR P J GREENHALGH

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Was recommended these as a reasonable priced running shoe ...they are fantastic they are comfortable and great to run in I am a 9 so went up to 9 and half as ment to with running awesome
customer_reviews.author: jan s.

customer_reviews.title: Not your typical running shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Strong shoes, a little too heavy. Seems more for off-road use. Also not to soft the landing spring. Good materials. Good looking.
customer_reviews.author: ENRIQUE RODRIGUEZ

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for the road / light trail from Inov-8
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe for the road / light trail from Inov-8. Plenty of flexibility and one doesn't feel "locked in" which is a feeling I often get when wearing other brands for road.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Stockman

customer_reviews.title: Very good running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Was dubious about buying online without trying them on but these fit perfectly, the Inov8 usually have a wide fit which suits me. Sufficient cushioning for reasonably long runs.
customer_reviews.author: D. Haylett

customer_reviews.title: Sizing
customer_reviews.text: Size chart shows 10,5 UK as 44,5 Eur but its actually 45
customer_reviews.author: Talant

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Bought for the London Marathon next year. Give me additional speed!!!
customer_reviews.author: S A Graham

customer_reviews.title: An Inov-8 shoe...
customer_reviews.text: An Inov-8 shoe... It means quality and comfort in our feet. However, the upper of these Road Claw 275 seems, at first glance, a little bit flimsy, perhaps because of the breathable mesh. I do not know if it will last long on the sides, where it breaks. Only time will tell. Besides this, I think it's a good (and good looking) running shoe.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are awful. I had them 3 months and they just fell apart. I really wouldn't bother, save your money. I used to love Inov8 but now I'm staying well away!
customer_reviews.author: blind boy grunt

product_meta.title: Inov8 Road Claw 275 V2 Running Shoes
product_meta.description: Inov8 Road Claw 275 V2 Running Shoes These road running shoes deliver a fast, natural and smooth run with high levels of comfort, protection and grip. The updated Roadclaw 275 V2 is lighter and more responsive, specifically designed with increased levels of cushioning and durability for longer training runs and races. Standard Fit Inov8's standard fit offers a close-fitting heel that locks the shoe in position, while a wider toe box allows the toes to splay when running naturally or lifting weights. Standard fit suits those with wider feet and athletes using the product for long sessions. Lightweight, Breathable Mesh Upper The Inov8 Roadclaw 275 V2 is constructed for improved responsiveness and flexibility for maximum comfort. The synthetic mesh that covers the upper offers lightweight and breathable coverage, allowing air to fully permeate the entire footbed, creating a more enjoyable experience for you as a runner and keeps your feet cool and comfortable when the temperatures rise. The Roadclaw utilises the met-cradle design which secures the midfoot hold that allows you to move naturally. It provides you with greater stability and control throughout. Additionally, an external heel counter wraps around the rear of the shoe and provides support in the heel delivering this extra hold that aids foot stability. The effect that this has, helps a fatigued runner maintain a better gait cycle. Powerflow Midsole Run effortlessly on the roads with the unique Powerflow midsole technology. Powerflow delivers 10% better shock absorption and 15% better energy return than standard midsoles. The reliable underfoot absorption provides greater comfort over miles by reducing forces pressed upon the underfoot platform for a clean strike through transition. The patented Dynamic Fascia Band (DFB) mimics the 'Windlass Effect' delivering a kick of energy with each step, helping you to move faster and more efficiently. The Inov-8's patented dynamic fascia band technology repl
feature_bullets: Mesh And Synthetic Upper - Lightweight comfort, durability and ventilation.
MET-Cradle - Secures the midfoot which provides you with the greater stability and control.
External Heel Counter - Provides added protection and durability.
PowerflowDelivers 10% shock absorption and 15% better energy return.
Dynamic Fascia Band - Delivers a kick of energy with each step, helping you move faster and more efficiently.
